Reviews.Title: Great Deal, but Not as Refined as Foscam - Makes Logitech a Joke
Reviews.Author: Kaio
Reviews.Content: We've been upgrading our security system from Logitech cams to IP cams, and let me tell ya, the difference is stark.  Logitech's security cams have always been wonky, but now with the addition of these new IP cams, Logitech's shortcomings have become stark.  Do yourself a favor, and get these IP cams instead.> Foscam vs TenvisThis Tenvis looks to be identical to this older Foscam FI8918W.  Tenvis performs just as well as this old model Foscam, but has a slightly narrower Pan & Tilt range:Tenvis: Horizontal 270°; Vertical 90°Foscam: Horizontal 270°; Vertical 120°That 30° difference in the vertical lens movement can be a big deal, depending on the environment where you're using the cams. A little extra coverage is never a bad thing.> User InterfaceTenvis just doesn't even come close to Foscam in this department.  Foscam is much more refined, pleasing to the eye and just downright easier to use.  Tenvis, by contrast, appears much cruder and rudimentary.  The UI is loaded onto each cam itself, so all you need is a web browser to view all the options.  Tenvis basically has the same features, but just not laid out as nicely as Foscam.> No IR LED ControlOne stunning omission with the Tenvis' functionality, is that you can NOT turn off the infra red LEDs manually.  This is important, because IR LEDs will NOT work through glass. Even though IR isn't visible to the naked eye, the cam certainly sees it, and if you try to place this in a window looking outside, all the cam sees is a white spotlight reflecting off the glass.  So in that instance, turning off the LEDs would be helpful.  Also, there's some cam locations that have plenty of light, even at night, so turning off the LEDs would help make the cam more stealth.  As it is, this is just not possible with Tenvis.> PerformanceThe wireless range doesn't appear to be as good with Tenvis compared to Foscam.  However, adding a longer external antenna seemed to help the issue. I got this one: WIFI 10 dBi 2.4GHz Antenna and they work quite well.  About 3.5x longer than the antenna that came with this Tenvis.  Definitely worthwhile.> ValueWe got this Tenvis for about half the cost of the new Foscam FI8916W - New Housing.  At that price, we just couldn't pass up on adding another cam to our system.  This cam is excellent for the money, but Foscam is better constructed, IMO.  This one just feels a bit cheap by comparison.  However, once it's mounted, none of that really matters, since it functions just fine.> Not As Many PTZ PresetsFoscam has 8, Tenvis has 6.  No stark difference, but certainly worth noting.> Works With Blue Iris SoftwareWe recently upgraded our software to Foscam Blue Iris Professional, and let me tell ya, it's fantastic.  Puts Logitech to shame for sure. Blue Iris works with almost every webcam, USB cam, and IP cam on the market.  Setting up this Tenvis on it was quick and seamless.**Note** - You can use EITHER Foscam or Tenvis settings for this cam.  Both work.  Just good to know, in case some unknown conflict arises.> Picture QualityThe images from the cam look fantastic. Seems to be on par with Foscam in this dept.  Nice, crystal clear images, and very detailed. Almost looks HD, even though it's the old standard of 640x480.> Pan & TiltTenvis isn't as smooth as Foscam with the pan and tilt movement.  The motor works fine, but the images can be a bit jerky.  This might be related to wireless range.  Nothing terrible, but worth noting.> Iffy Mounting BracketBy far, Tenvis is inferior to Foscam in this dept.  Their mount just feels cheap by comparison, and like it could easily break if you over-tighten your screws.  Plus, the angle adjustment knobs just don't stay in place as nicely, or clamp down as tight as Foscam's mounting bracket.  If you bump your Tenvis, or don't handle it gingerly, the bracket moves from where you've set it and you have to make readjustments.> Loud PTZ MotorIf you're planning on recording audio from this Tenvis, be aware that the mic picks up the PTZ motor while it's moving.  When the PTZ motor stops, you can hear audio just fine.  But once that motor kicks in again, you won't hear much, other than that PTZ motor whirring quite loudly into the mic.> SetupYou'll need some knowledge of IP addresses and basic routing, but nothing difficult.  A few paragraphs of reading at most.  Very easy to setup and get going.  Mine was up and running within 15 minutes.  Granted, it was another day or 2 of tinkering to refine everything exactly how I want it, but the initial setup took no time at all.  I didn't even read the enclosed material; just jumped right in and got it all setup in a snap.Bottom Line -- This is a fantastic IP cam for the money, but the user interface isn't as user friendly as Foscam.  If I need another budget cam, I'd definitely get another Tenvis.  However, if there's a deal to be had on Foscam, I'd pick that one over Tenvis for sure.  We're quite happy with our Tenvis, particularly at the price we got it for.  Hands-down it kicks Logiteh's arse; very nice to finally be dumping WiLife.  Happy! ;oD

Reviews.Title: Great price and easy to set up
Reviews.Author: TouchScreen
Reviews.Content: This might be the first review on Amazon of the Tenvis JPT3815W. I originally wanted to go with the Foscam since it was the most popular of the same type of IP camera, but decided to take a chance with the Tenvis. The little booklet manual was easy to follow and has good illustrations and photos. Set it up first with the ethernet cable before attempting wireless setup. The software auto-detects your network and puts the camera in the same IP address range. I got it all working and was viewing over the LAN in under a half-hour. With some port-forwarding knowledge, you can set the camera up for remote view on your smartphone, which I did with the excellent Android phone app, TinyCam Monitor Pro. Picture quality is good and focus can be manually adjusted by turning the ring around and night-vision works very well.When operating, a green LED flashes continuously but unfortunately there is no way to turn it off in the software and hopefully the manufacturer will have a fix for it sometime in the near future.

Reviews.Title: Works, but buggy
Reviews.Author: Stuart WL
Reviews.Content: I purchased the TENVIS after previously ordering a Foscam and finding it DOA.  The TENVIS is basically a cheaper version of the Foscam.  There are several things I like about it, and a few things that knocked off some stars.Pros1.  Super easy to set up. I plugged it in to my router and within minutes I was able to stream video over my home network.2.  Night vision - we use it as a baby monitor when we want to "look in" on him sleeping.  The picture is bright and clear on the video.  In his room, you can barely see the IR LEDs.  The room stays nice and dark.3.  When you log in and select iPad, the controls are very limited, so I tried selecting "non IE browser" and it works great on the iPad!  Full control, brightness, panning, everything.Cons1.  The English translations are terrible.  For example, there is a green LED on the front of the camera.  In the menu, you can set it to "Open" "Close" or "Flicker".  (Actually: On, Off, Blink.).  Another example are the controls to allow you to speak to your computer and hear it out the camera, and speak to the camera and hear it on the computer (this only works under IE).  The controls are labeled "Speak to Camera" and "Voice to Camera".  Which one is which????2.  The camera seems to crash IE quite often (Windows 7, IE 9 and 10) but is rock-solid on Firefox and Safari/iPad3.  Camera often resets itself at night and will end up pointing in another direction.  The solution for us was the create a "preset" with the camera pointing at the crib, then set it up that after a reset the camera would automatically go to the preset.4.  NO VIDEO RECORDING - even though it's SUPPOSED to record video, there is a bug known to the manufacturer the prevents it working correctly with Windows Vista/7/8.  I don't have XP on anything, so I can't test that, but the TENVIS website indicates lots of people having trouble with the video recording under Vista/7/8 and TENVIS reporting that they are working on a fix.  As of July 2, 2013, this was not fixed yet.So, the camera is ok. It works, was easy to set up, and does the job, but it still has some semi-serious flaws. Once these are corrected, I think it would be a really good deal.

Reviews.Title: Manufacturer bribes reviewers
Reviews.Author: JF
Reviews.Content: By leaving less than a 5-star review, I'm costing myself $15. The manufacturer offers a $15 "rebate" (read: bribe) for 5-star reviews of this product.The camera is decent, and I'm happy with my purchase. I would give 4 stars, as it's not perfect (requires internet explorer to do video recording), but the practice of bribery to skew reviews that shoppers rely upon to make informed purchases is low.

Reviews.Title: Junk
Reviews.Author: Bookman
Reviews.Content: These cameras are nice when they work, but they don't work very long. Ordered 2 of them. First one failed the second day it was in use. Second failed 2 weeks after the return window closed, which means I get to deal with warranty support via Tenvis. Both cameras were mounted inside the house. Meanwhile my Foscam, which has been abused by being mounted in a cold garage, is still going strong more than a year after I bought it. Tenvis appears attractive because it's about $25 or so cheaper than the Foscams, but the failure rate has been unacceptable.

Reviews.Title: WARNING: STAR RATINGS ARE FAKE/PURCHASED - STAY AWAY
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: First the reviews here are BOUGHT. In the package Tenvis promises a USD15 review if you leave a 4 star or higher feedback. If you want to leave a less than 4 star you should email them. But you only get the rebate for 4+. If you need to set cam to a custom ip (or have it get ip from your router) then it wont work with the tenvis android app. So I tried other app (ipcamviewer).. the cam works with that app.. but the camera audio feed that is promised is broken. Purchased reviews are wrong, probably violate amazon terms and skew comparison. STAY AWAY and buy a product that does not buy ratings!!

Reviews.Title: Pile of rubbish
Reviews.Author: Dillymint
Reviews.Content: Instructions were all but useless. Plug in this or that and you'll see your camera listed... etc etc etc... errrr. No I don't. After much messing about and using my own knowledge and common sense (not the instructions from the manufacturer). I got it working. For 3 weeks. Then it stopped working very suddenly and without reason. Am now on about my 4th hour of trying to get this piece of rubbish to work. It flashes and spins and all sorts. Very pretty. Nice as a flashy christmas tree decoration perhaps, but not as a camera. My laptop and my friends computer (that I borrowed to see if my laptop was the issue)cannot find it connected directly with a cable, connected to my router with a cable, or wirelessly. Do not buy. Google it and see how many people have had problems. I've only given this 1 star because Amazon won't like me write this review with zero stars.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Marla
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive way to monitor my house while away and this product exceeds my expectations.  While the setup can be challenging, the Tenvis technical support was very prompt!  This product allows me to monitor my house (and pets) where ever I may be through either 3G access from my smartphone (either android or iphone)  or internet access.  The Pan and Tilt functionality of this camera allows me to monitor my entire living room with just one camera.  Therefore, I'm able to sit at work and scan my living room to make sure my everything is ok.  Also, it has 2 way audio where I can hear what's happening at home and also talk through the camera.  You can also record through the camera (to your pc) and take "snapshots" of moments in time.  I've looked at other surveillance systems and for the price of just one camera, this could not be beat.  You can add up to 9 cameras and monitor your entire house.  There is also an "alarm" function that will email you if there is "motion" in front of the camera.  It takes "snapshots" of the motion and includes them in the email.  This amazes me for the $60 price range.  To get the most functionality out of the camera remotely, you must use Internet Explorer, but you do have limited functionality from other web browsers.  The "smartphone" functionality is much more limited than using a web browser, but to be able to view your house through your phone is pretty impressive.  I've just ordered two more cameras for my house which is still "cheaper" than many of the other surveillance systems I've seen that ultimately have fewer bells and whistles.  I've very impressed with the camera!

Reviews.Title: Works great.  No Audio
Reviews.Author: Bradly-James
Reviews.Content: I love this camera.  Easy setup and use.If you are looking to buy this camera, DON'T buy it in the hopes of audio.  For audio to work you have to use Internet Explorer and ActiveX.  95% of the time I am accessing it through my cell phone or tablet.

Reviews.Title: When they work, they work. When they dont, they dont
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought five of these cameras for two different locations. Four months later, ALL have partially or completely stopped working. I chose this brand because of the price, but it looks like you get what you pay for. I have contacted the manufacturer, and they respond, in their own time, via email. You have to push them hard to get action. I do not recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: CONSTANTLY QUITS WORKING! BEWARE!
Reviews.Author: jason coleman
Reviews.Content: DO NOT BUY! CONSTANTLY GOES OFFLINE!! SUPPORT IS TERRIBLE! THIS IS THE WORST CAMERA  I HAVE EVER HAD IN MY LIFE. CONSTANT PROBLEMS THAT HAVE TO BE RE-FIXED OVER AND OVER AND OVER. Support takes 12 hours to respond and then a week or two later you get the same problems you've had before! Amazon should ban this product from even being sold!!!

Reviews.Title: good product - horrible directions/interface/manual
Reviews.Author: Matt Gershner "Matt"
Reviews.Content: The camera seems to work well, but you need to be smarter than your average user in setting it up as the documentation and web interface appear to have been written in Chinese first and then translated into English by someone who speaks something other than English or Chinese as a first language.It's a little slow to respond to commands, but it appears that is normal for this type of product.  Overall for the money - it's good, just wish the documentation and portal were easier to work with.

Reviews.Title: PITA, but works (or does it?)
Reviews.Author: KB "KB"
Reviews.Content: Install was a pain for the wireless. Wired worked great, but the wireless would always fail on the port check. Manually setting up the wireless also failed. After I updated the installer and the firmware from the site, the installer still failed but the manual setup was successful.Foscams are much easier to install.UPDATE:After getting it to finally work on wireless, it does not respond to the camera controls. Works great on the wired connection, but this is unusable for me and I am returning it.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Dave & Dessa "Addictive"
Reviews.Content: I got this cam about a month ago. Works great was simple to setup. Directions are spot on unlike some others.I use it in the living room to monitor My Grandfather of 85yrs. Alarm is nice sends out emails promptly & can adjust the intervals between the images sent.I would gladly purchase another tenvis when I need it. Just wish it was weather proof & capable of easily modifying the Control panel.If it was weatherproof I would put it under my eaves & possibly dump my DVR unit.I will end up purchasing another tenvis unit in the future.Also the tech support from Tenvis is excellent. I have communicated with them on skype & great communication.Would highly suggest to others for a inexpensive camera.Audio is not the greatest on the unit but it does the job. (You need to have it closer to where you wish to hear) And the built in speaker could use higher volume but It works fine for what Most of us need it for.Also the power cable is not long enough I will be splicing it to make it longer unless I can find a extension for it.If the cable was 10-20' I would have rated it 5stars.

Reviews.Title: Returned...
Reviews.Author: Boatguy
Reviews.Content: UPDATE Aug 31 2013:  Returned the camera. We could not access the camera via Android phone outside of the house, which is really the feature we were looking for when we purchased. No matter what we did or procedure we followed, the camera was not accessible outside the home.Also, the motion detection feature sent us hundreds of emails even when there was no motion (camera facing a blank wall). When you're away and have no way of turning the motion detect feature off your email inbox can get very full.Too bad, in theory this camera is a great idea but comes up very short. Once refined and tested this will be a great camera. Until all advertised features are tested and bugs worked out I would not recommend this product at all.I ordered this with guarded skepticism but we are very happy with it. The camera arrived today and we were up and running (hard wired) in about 30 minutes. It took 30 minutes to get going because I had to reread the instructions a couple of times. My first suggestion is to read and FOLLOW the instructions. Right when I was ready to give up and get in touch with the manufacturer, I reread the instructions and found where I went wrong. A simple instruction I did not follow/overlooked caused me some headache. The computer AND the camera have to be hard wired to the wireless router for the initial setup. Once I plugged my laptop into the wireless router with a cat5 cable, everything went fine (it was right in the instructions). I will tell you, I had to go into the manual setup (not the wizard) in order to set the proper hardware for the laptop. The software that came with the camera recognized some other "thing" for the communicating device on my laptop. Once I went into the manual configuration and manually selected "Intel blah blah blah" as the communicating device on the laptop, all went well after that. I am not a tech person at all and I was able to get this camera up and running in 30 minutes (hard wired). READ THE INSTRUCTIONS. Tomorrow I will tackle the wifi set up and will report back. Right now the camera is connected to my router with a cat5 cable and my laptop is back in the office connected via wifi and I can access the camera no problem.  I will tell you the camera works well and we are totally happy with it. There is little to no color to the picture, it's mostly black and white but there is a little color (night vision is black and white but very clear). If you are looking for a high def super camera this is not the one. If you are looking for a decent camera to monitor a room or your house, it works fine. I just accessed the camera (middle of the night) and the night vision works great!! The pan and tilt feature is fantastic and it is very quiet when adjusting. The two way sound is awful, very weak, and there is a delay of several seconds but it does work (sort of). Listening is much better than speaking. I can hear pretty well from the camera to my laptop, but the speaker on the camera is terrible. You can select two way comm., listen only or speak only. The software is pretty good and has lots of configurable features including warnings, motion detections, snapshots, video record, and email alerts. I read one review that said the green power LED on the front of the camera was a distraction. The software lets you choose whether or not the LED light is on, blinking, or completely off (we chose off). We intend to use this camera to keep an eye on our house while we are out. Again, tomorrow I will check out the wifi and see how hard it is to setup. Will report on that later. So far this camera has far exceeded our expectations for the price.UPDATE Day two:Wifi setup was fairly easy, just follow the instructions. The camera works well via LAN and wifi but I can not get it to work on my phone with 3g/4g/lte, only via wifi on the phone. If I turn on wifi on my android phone, I can use the remote IPCam app and it works well. If I shut off wifi on my android phone and try to access the camera using the data network it does not work. I believe it has something to do with port forwarding but I can not access my router through their setup wizard or the manual mode either. I have a belkin wireless router and when I choose belkin and input my security info, it will not recognize or access the router (in their setup software). So whenever I try to setup port forwarding it fails in the setup program. There is a tutorial on the tenvis website that explains how to manually set up port forwarding in a belkin router but I am not savy enough to do it (I tried but to no avail). Well as I stated earlier I am not a tech person. I have spent a day and a half trying to get it to work on my phone using data only but it looks like I will give up for now. I will search the internet and see if I can find a more specific solution to my problem.We set up the alert and email so when the camera detects motion it takes a snapshot and sends an email alert to you. Very nice but be sure to shut it off when you are home or your email inbox will fill up quickly!! Don't forget to turn it on when you leave...Overall very happy with the camera, decent picture especially night vision, very quiet when adjusting, just need to keep in mind what I paid for it.Two cons:The camera's IR LEDs are not IR, they are faint red LEDs. True IR is invisible to the human eye. The LEDs are very faint but visible. They are noticeable in a dark room but IMO not a distraction. Again, keep in mind the price.Also, The setup guide is written by people that are using english as a second language so it's not always clear, the illustrations help. The setup can be difficult for those of us with only basic computer skills. Still can not get the IPCam app to work on my android phone using only a data connection.Again we are happy with this camera and will probably buy a couple more to cover some blind spots in the house.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: marco3699
Reviews.Content: The setup was very easy, gave detailed instructions with minimum requirements. I think the best thing about this camera is the ability to control it from your phone. The email alerts when there is motion is awesome to. I highly recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Too slow to use, false Amazon reviews
Reviews.Author: Rory Groves
Reviews.Content: Based on the great Amazon reviews, I was looking forward to putting this camera to use. The first red flag was a flyer packed with the box that offered to send me a $15 check if I left a 5 star review on Amazon. Is that even allowed?I have 20 years in IT and was able to figure out how to get the camera connected to my wifi network -- but I feel bad for folks who are not I/T experts. For average users, the setup is ridiculously complex.But aside from all that, the camera doesn't work well. The color is terrible, almost black and white. But the worst part is the sluggishness of the camera to respond to controls. I ran a network test and discovered a consistent 30% packet loss which means out of the box the unit is only operating at 70% advertised speeds. Often my browser would fail to load it completed (timed out after 90 seconds).I like the IP web cam approach, but Tenvis is unacceptable and I am returning it today.

Reviews.Title: NO Company service. Cant talk to Tenvis.
Reviews.Author: Scott Roth
Reviews.Content: It works fine if I have my lap top in the house. If I go and connect to a WIFI out of the house it wont work. I tried to call Tenvis about 10 times and all I get is a message to go to the web page. The Web page is of little help.

Reviews.Title: OK alternative to Foscam but has a few flaws
Reviews.Author: Joe User
Reviews.Content: (updated below)For the price this is a great product. If you can set up a FOSCAM you'll have no problem with this camera. Here is the nitty gritty on what you need to know:Wifi works on B/G with encryption (WPA2 works)Setup is a little sketchy but not hard if you know what you're doing (reference the foscam setup info if u need help)Use firefox or chrome to set this cam up because the active X control is not signed. It's easy to bypass (but you'll need to google how yourself)Picture quality is acceptable but not great, consider the price point and it becomes great!Works great with Blue Iris (choose foscam 89xx as the type)Seems durable as I managed to drop it from the top of a 15ft ladder, it landed on the gravel and still worked perfectly. This is probably due to the HW seeming to be exactly the same as foscam.Night vision reaches about 12 feet or so in pitch blackness. Not quite as far as the foscam, but acceptable. There is also a green blinking LED on the front of this cam.There seems to be a focus ring on the front, I did not try to move it as the focus was correct for my needs.It does audio, sounds about the same as the foscam 8918. I don't use the mic to talk so I can't say how that is.Other thoughts:If you want a cheap alternative to the foscam 8910 or 8918 this is it! I have 2 foscams and paid a heafty fee for the name. I will be purchasing Tenvis going forward. The built in web interface works alright, but it's not great. Using this with BlueIris is identical to my foscam PTZ cam. The camera might be a hair lower in picture quality, but it's real close and might just be a placebo effect since I paid $30 more for the foscam. This is being used in a 84x58ft pole barn mounted upside down (with included hardware) 15ft high. It does the job of giving me peace of mind that no one is trying to steal my gear. Highly recommended product.***UPDATE***I am lowering my rating for this camera after using it for a month. After the second week I am experiencing anomalies with this camera. The major reason I removed 3 stars is because it randomly freezes and loses connectivity with the network. It might work fine for 2 hours, or two weeks, but eventually the power will have to be cycled in order for the camera to regain wireless network connectivity. At first I was reluctant to update my review, because I wanted this camera to work out for me as an alternative to more expensive models. So I did all the due diligence in updating the firmware to the latest version, and when that failed to fix the random disconnect, I moved the router to within 12 feet with line of sight. Unfortunately this setup only worked for about two weeks until it disconnected again. I could run a LAN line but the camera is mounted 15' in the air, and well I feel like wireless should work! I thought the router could be the problem, even though 2 other IP cams are working on it great, so I swapped that out as well. No dice. The tenvis worked overnight and lost connection AGAIN. So by this time I was ready to pitch this at 90mph in the trash. Fortunately I found an old Christmas light timer, which I set to cycle once per day. This did the trick and the tenvis is working alright for me now. Really though, after all of this, I would just buy a foscam next time. Overall it was worth a try on this brand but it just isn't in the same league as the foscam, and for $30 bucks less I don't really expect it to be. But it should work 24/7 and unfortunately it simply does not.Recap:PROS: cheap price, acceptable picture quality, UV night vision works, Pan and tilt with presets work, works with BlueIris, accepts WPA2 wireless, audio works (see cons).CONS: loses connectivity with WiFi @ random intervals, resolution jumps from 640 to a lower res depending on how you pan/tilt, audio quality is poor at best (lots of popping and distortion but it does work well enough to hear noises and such - sets off false alarms in blueiris), no way to disable LED blinking light, night vision is very weak (only 11 UV leds), power needs to be cycled every week or so.Final thoughts (updated): Overall I would only use this cam if I were very tight on cash and was willing to manually reset it once in a while. I am using an automatic light timer to cycle this once per day and that works OK, but trust me just spend the extra cash on a better brand. I have had none of these problems with my foscam, loftek, or trendnet ip cams.

Reviews.Title: Cheap and works well!
Reviews.Author: Ed
Reviews.Content: Surprised at the low price. Setup is relatively straight-forward. Do know that you need to do port-forwarding if you want to view the cameras when not connected to home wifi. Overall, very nice though!

Reviews.Title: POS camera
Reviews.Author: Opiate
Reviews.Content: Software is horrible within this brand.  It's in chinglish, cumbersome to set up, locks up frequently.  The motion detection settings would not change sensitivities and was stuck on highly sensitive so if you have a fan going in the room you could expect tons of false alarms and slow the camera's performance down dramatically.  The power adapter, oddly, would spark everytime I plugged the camera  in then eventually the adapter died.

Reviews.Title: Cheap alternative to Foscams. Recommended with reservations...
Reviews.Author: Happy Dog
Reviews.Content: Of course these are the cheaper cousins of the Foscams. I use these to monitor less important locations. Setup wizard software has gotten slightly better. 3 major downsides are:1) No way to turn off the IR unlike the Foscams. So if there happens to be a pole or wall corner close to the cam, the IR reflections can wash out the screen. Thinking about looking out of a glass window with this? impossible. The IR reflection makes this unit worthless for that.2) The lower front LED flashes all the time. No way to turn that off either.3) The unit does randomly reboot a lot more than my Foscams. Not that the Foscams are perfect either, but they seem more stable.

Reviews.Title: Too many false motion detections
Reviews.Author: Jerry Warner
Reviews.Content: I have a couple of cameras similar to this made by other manufacturers.  The Tenvis is nice in that it has night vision built in, is wireless, and has a decent picture.  It's a pretty decent cheap IP camera actually.My reason for giving it the low rating is because of it's motion detection.  Even with the unit set in its least sensitive setting it still triggers motion detection when there is no motion.  To test this unit I placed it into my office with the door shut, windows closed. Blinds closed.  The room still had some light in it because the blinds are not opaque.  I set the camera so that it viewed about 1/4 of the room with the wall about 10 feet away from it.  There were no electronics or papers in the shot that might move to trigger motion.With the unit in the least sensitive setting it soon began to send alerts to my email saying it detected motion.  Over the course of the weekend it sent out over 7MB of photos.  Dozens and dozens of them day and night.  If  person was thinking they could use this to somehow be aware that someone had moved in this space they would need to dig though so many pictures to find out that it would be very time consuming.  And that was just for a single weekend.  I was literally getting alerts every few minutes from this thing.With so many alerts being generated it's useless as any sort of a security device or alert.  If you want a cheap real-time camera this one will get the job done.  If you want it for anything more than that, save your money.  Of the cameras I have, this one did the poorest at actually detecting motion correctly.

Reviews.Title: Does not stand behind product.
Reviews.Author: W. Enteron "W. Enteron"
Reviews.Content: Electrical plug broke, right soon.  Call to Tenvis, voice mail only.  Detailed message.  Tenvis ignored call.  Now chasing to Radio Shack for cord/transformer.

Reviews.Title: quit working after 2 months
Reviews.Author: thomas sharkey
Reviews.Content: I bought this item and was very pleased with its performance. It was easy to set up and worked great remotely from my phone.  But then it just stopped working.

Reviews.Title: Worked Great While Lasted
Reviews.Author: Avanak Avni
Reviews.Content: Works great within the Wifi perimeters. Cell phone app is just ok. Alerts send snapshot images 24 hrs a day. Good quality on night time mode.Update: After using this camera about 2 months Camera died. The head stopped turning, and high pitch noise start coming from the unit.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, easy to setup... here's how
Reviews.Author: JohnBlazini
Reviews.Content: Camera is great if you're looking for a low res wireless solution for <$50.First of all, follow the instructions to setup the camera with an ethernet cable. Then, throw them away or keep them for reference, but they are virtual useless after initial use.In the settings menu accessible from the viewer (web browser), click the button that renews the IP assignments and what not. This will reset the port number from its default of 7777. The new number could be 7778, for example.Go into your router's menu and setup a port forward rule for whatever IP the camera is on your wifi network. Use the refreshed port number from the step above.Access your camera from any browser by typing in your network's IP address accompanied with ":" and whatever the port number was that you forwarded earlier.Checkers, not Chess.1. install wired connection using instructions2. renew/refresh camera IP via the settings menu in the viewer3. port forward new renewed/refreshed camera IP in your router's menu4. enjoy while mobile

Reviews.Title: A Great value for the price
Reviews.Author: markE
Reviews.Content: Camera installed easily to my home network -- both wired and wi-fi.  If you want to view this device outside of your immediate network, you will have to port forward.  Port forwarding sounds scary, but it's really not hard to do. The online manual that comes with the camera has all of the details for most of the popular routers.  Follow the instructions and you are in business.  Only caution is with the amount of data an IP camera will send to you.  Generally not a problem on wi-fi, but if you are using your phone's data plan, it will eat up your allotment very quickly.  I had to temporarily bump up my plan to a larger data package to avoid an overage.  But now I understand the issue will will only use the cam remotely with a wi-fi connection.  Free Android app (Tenvis Sight) works slick ... even found another 3rd party app that works just as well with the cam.  I loaded that one on my Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: Great value
Reviews.Author: Keith Thibodeaux
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price. I found it to be extremely simple to setup. It works best with a different software package for motion detection alerts instead of the one built-in. I just disable that one and use a product called ContaCam (free). Works great!

Reviews.Title: set up horrible. camera good
Reviews.Author: Hannah Flynt
Reviews.Content: We are not able to get remote access. The directions are not easy to understand and it shouldn't take a degree in computer science to set it up

Reviews.Title: Great Cameras
Reviews.Author: Chris Christenson
Reviews.Content: Really Great Cameras. Easy to setup, easy to use. I love them. The SD Card slot is really nice to have them record to so you don't need to buy a separate DVR.

Reviews.Title: Solid little camera, works well with third party software
Reviews.Author: I can see Russia
Reviews.Content: had it up and running in an hour with port forwarding and faceable to the web.  controllable with third party software on smartphone. easy to use, good low light capabilities.  works well!

Reviews.Title: Great Value - Affordable and Exceeds Customer Expectations!
Reviews.Author: AmazonIsAwesome
Reviews.Content: This is certainly the best bang for the buck.  Great Quality Product and resolution with a multitude of interfaces for monitoring (i.e, PC, laptop, iphone, IPAD, etc.), and very user friendly.  Very easy to install  (hardware and software).  Just what I was looking for an more (did not know it had audio and scanning capability!).

Reviews.Title: Great tech support
Reviews.Author: Alison Olson
Reviews.Content: Connecting the camera was a bit difficult for me. I consider myself somewhat tech savvy, however, couldn't quite figure out all of the wizards. I emailed the support team for some help and received a very detailed response within 2 days. I am very happy with the help I received and love the camera.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera
Reviews.Author: Lisa Hensley
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with the Tenvis Camera.  Easy to set up.  I have another brand IP camera so setup was a breeze.Pro'sEasy setupGood pictureDecent night visionAble to view remotely when away from home.ConsUnable to turn IR off ( no big deal for me though)I would recommend this camera to others.

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: David M Wangsgard
Reviews.Content: This is a great product to use for our newborn baby monitor. It is so nice to be able to connect it to my phone so i don't have to haul around a big bulky monitor to see if our baby is doing well. This product was recommended to us, and we would definitely recommend it to our friends and family. Plus the cost was great compared to some other monitors. It is nice to know it has night vision and we can use it for many other purposes besides a baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: It's cool, but I can't see what's going on when I'm not home.
Reviews.Author: F. Smith "amazonaholic"
Reviews.Content: Easy set-up. Pretty good instructions. LAN cable included. The camera works great on Wi-Fi in the home, but I can't access it remotely through 3G or internet away from the house. I have been through the Port Forwarding rigmarole on my wireless router, but remote connection is not sustained. There are a lot of people complaining about this, I have found (reading reviews & support forums). I do like the motion detection notices sent via email. Even if I can't access the camera remotely, I still get notifications that motion was detected. You may want to Motion Detection on on the lowest setting as shadows from trees were setting it off even on the normal setting. If I could get the remote access working, I'd have rated this a 5.

Reviews.Title: Not working
Reviews.Author: Damian
Reviews.Content: Just a computer engineer can put in on work, 2 weekends working on it.....nothing, not support, no service....nothing.waste of time and money

Reviews.Title: Poor instructions
Reviews.Author: skyscraper
Reviews.Content: Very poor instructions. If you need help the call is overseas. Works  but can't get speaker and auto email  to phone to work.

Reviews.Title: extermely disappointed
Reviews.Author: Tony Gupton
Reviews.Content: This unit is very difficult to set up for remote viewing outside your LAN which I would imagine is the primary reason for purchasing  an IP camera. Do not purchase this unit unless you are an IT expert and have a static IP address to assign to this unit.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Alex B.
Reviews.Content: Excellent Wireless Camera!  Works great. Easy to set up.  Nice pan and zoom.  Works on my android phone and IPad.

Reviews.Title: Does not work in IE11, Chrome, or Firefox.  No phone support.  Poor quality hardware
Reviews.Author: Joe User
Reviews.Content: The antenna connector is loose and spins as you try to attach the antenna which then will not stand upright.If you fight through that, the live view does not work in IE11/Win7 even after downloading suggested activex and verifying firmware.  Looking at the vendor site, this is a known issue for at least 8 months.  The suggested fix of adding to trusted sites failed to help.Beware, you can view only the live feed in Chrome, and Firefox, with no functionality for motion capture by [lack of] design.I tried the US "customer service" to be dumped into a voice mailbox.

Reviews.Title: Total piece of CRAP!!!  Save yourself  a lot of agravation and AVOID AT ALL COSTS!
Reviews.Author: Paul R. Lusk
Reviews.Content: Wasted two days trying to set up two of these, and was only able to get them viewable from within my home network.  I could NOT view them from the Internet.  I have several older Tenvis cameras along with two EasyN models that I have been using for years, even mounted them outside under the eaves, and they work perfectly.  I know all about port forwarding and routers, etc. On one it would detect WiFi signals, but would not connect to them.  On the second model, it connected via WiFi, but I could not access it via the internet.  Oh, and on the first one, it would re-boot itself every other minute, go through the "patrol" feature, over and over again.  I tired turning off tilt and pan, but it still reset itself every other minute.  I have a Cisco WRT320 Router, which the Tenvis software did not even recognize or mention in their selection list.  VERY DISAPPOINTED!  I guess the first clue should have been the $15 rebate offer for a 4 or 5 star review - glad I tried to set it up first!

Reviews.Title: cannot watch live feed
Reviews.Author: GrayFox
Reviews.Content: Note: I am using a Mac.After 3 hours trying to get the port forwarding set up, I am returning the camera. Setting up the wifi network and alarm (email) notifications were quite easy. However, once the camera was disconnected directly from the router, I could not watch the feed from my laptop. I am not the most technologically savvy person, but I followed the instructions that came with camera, including the  additional instructions found on port forwarding. I set up everything as described, and still no live feed. I will look for a camera that is much more user friendly and does not require additional router (port forwarding) set up, if it exists.

Reviews.Title: At The Price, It's Pretty Good!
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: This is the first IP camera I've ever bought so I don't really have much to compare it to. That being said, for a $40 WiFi camera it's pretty dang cool.  Once you get it set up you can remotely view it wherever you are; from a web browser a smartphone or tablet.The tilt/pan/zoom feature is very smooth, if a little slow, and you can set 6 preset positions.  It also has a microphone and speaker so you can speak to someone through it and hear their response; a pretty cool option if you want to use it at your front door (a la Wizard of Oz style).The camera has a motion detection mode and "patrol" mode (my words not theirs) where the camera scans slowly in circles or up and down; useful for security purposes.The setup was easy.  Just plug it into your wireless router, follow the setup instructions from your browser, unplug it and put it where you want it.The mobile setup for your phone is pretty easy too.  I was concerned that it would be difficult to setup to view remotely because I don't have a dedicated IP address, but TENVIS has a service that you set up for free that allows you to remotely view the camera image (and control the tilt/pan) from your smartphone or tablet.  It took about 10 minutes to set up.  You need to make some configurations to your router but the TENVIS website has easy to follow instructions.I was also pleasantly surprised at how good the night vision mode is.  It is very clear, even in a totally dark room.  I keep it in my garage to see if I forgot to close the door at night and to keep an eye on the kids outside during the day.  It serves both purpose well.My only complaint is that it doesn't zoom, but I guess you gotta break out more than $40 for that!

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA !
Reviews.Author: James T. Rook "Turtleman"
Reviews.Content: So far it has even worked in 11 degree weather on my front porch. (SHELTERED ...way back from the weather ....)READ THE INSTRUCTIONS, and FOLLOW THE INSTRUCTIONS.DO NOT BE CREATIVEYou will need TWO six foot long Ethernet cords to make this a flawless installation .... one from your computer to the ROUTER, and the other from the router to the camera.  After the "folks" know who everybody is, you can disconnect the cords until you need to install another camera.  I bought cheap Ethernet cords off of Ebay for less than ten dollars, delivered.IT HAS A STANDARD TRIPOD SCREW RECEPTACLE IN THE BOTTOM  YAY!TOM.ROOK@TECHNIK-SA.US...

Reviews.Title: Pretty decent for the price but some issues
Reviews.Author: Paul Kruger "Web Developer"
Reviews.Content: In general I like the camera but it has a few issues I have not been able to resolve.One is color rendition.  It is not consistent. I have a red barn but when I view it in the camera it appears bright green.  My blue recycle bins appear pale red. At other times the colors are correct.  There seem to be no settings to adjust or otherwise correct for improper color display on screen.The FLIP function does not always stay set.  I have to mount camera upside down to use it from the ceiling of my front porch so rely on the FLIP to turn image right side up.  Any change to any other setting seems to reset the flipped image so I see everything upside down again.When using the Android app there is no option to change this so unless I am home where I can use the web interface, I have no way to turn the image right side up if it "forgets" it setting. ( I have to turn the phone upside down and the PTZ arrows are backwards in this configuration )There is an alarm option but after many hundreds of false positive emails with images attached I realized that it will trigger an event if a gnat flies past at 20 feet!  Makes the alarm function useless as it is always triggering even with nothing moving.Also the function for an audible alarm does not seem to work. I turn in on in the web interface but nothing happens.Bottom line, the price is good and it works pretty well with decent ( not HD ) resolution. If you don't mind strange colors and if you can use it right side up you will probably be happy with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: MVP
Reviews.Content: I already had 2 Foscam FI8910W and was looking to add 2 more cameras when I came across these Tenvis JPT3815W. These were much easier to setup and configure than I expected, and the quality of the image and features are just as good as the Foscam ... if not better. They worked flawless with my DComplex IP Camera Recorder on my iMac and showed up instantly on my iPhone app after they were added to the recorder.

Reviews.Title: Very economical for the job it does
Reviews.Author: jimmie p
Reviews.Content: This camera works very well and is priced much less than conquerable camera's. I can use it with both my Mac or PC and it once you have it set up with your router things go very smoothly after that.Be sure to take on setting up the sensitivity. We went out of town and I was receiving a lot of emails when my camera would point up and detect the movement of our ceiling fan.......totally my fault during the set up.I would recommend this product for home security.

Reviews.Title: Not Ready for primetime.
Reviews.Author: Beetee
Reviews.Content: Got it running in no time, setup was not an issue keeping it running is. Crashes every couple of minutes. Replaced with a foscam much better runs for days. Do yourself a favor and look elsewhere. I also don't like any product that tries to purchase 5 star reviews by offering money, rebates etc. A good product will always stand on its own.

Reviews.Title: Some problems
Reviews.Author: attic
Reviews.Content: Arrived with the CD disc broken. Could have sent it back but the papers said the instructions could be downloaded,  so I did. Instructions were not as clear as they should be. Finally got the camera to work after several tries. Used a download app to control from my Android device but at one point it said to contact my Internet provider if I was unable to get it to work properly. From the app I am able to view ok, but I can't control the movement. From the Web I am able to control the movement but occasionally it readjusts itself and points up . I don't care for devices that take so much time to set up and I don't like going back and forth between the Web and the app to control everything. My first experience did not go smoothly. The camera worked fine,  the instructions and setup did not.

Reviews.Title: Great Picture and Camera
Reviews.Author: Robert Miletich
Reviews.Content: This camera really works well; I purchased several for my office environment and they have functioned flawlessly. I use Blue Iris software, and it was very easy to set up.I highly recommend the Tenvis JPT3815 Wireless IP Pan/Tilt/Night cameras.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: GARY SHADOAN
Reviews.Content: the camera is easy to setup  the only problem  i have is getting the audio to work probaly just a simple patch

Reviews.Title: Serious WiFi Problem, but perhaps resolvable
Reviews.Author: NY Reader
Reviews.Content: There are some good things about this device, and I'll get to them later.  My one star review is based on the total failure of the WiFi connection.The instructions for WiFi setup are clear enough, and there is additional information on the Tenvis website.  However, after working on this for several hours, I have been unable to get it to connect.WiFi connection in general cannot be difficult.  I have several laptops, various iPhones and iPods, an iPad, a Wii, an Apple TV, a wireless printer and even a Nintendo Gameboy connected to my network by WiFi, and they all connected to the network immediately, stay connected, and re-connect automatically after reboot of either the device or the wireless router.  But my camera wouldn't connect at all, and other people have said that their camera regularly drops its WiFi connection.I'm sad to have to say this, because everything else about the camera works.  When connected by ethernet cable, the utility program finds it on the network, and launches the camera view on a webpage, from which the camera is configurable.  The iPhone app lets me view the picture on my iPhone, and the camera can be controlled from both the webpage and the iPhone app.Tenvis provides a DDNS service that allows the camera to be accessed from outside the local network using a web address rather than an IP address.  (For most home users, the IP address can be changed regularly by the ISP, so isn't a good way to identify the device.)  The web address appears to be specific to the camera (e.g. usXXXXX.mytenvis).  Use of this service requires that port forwarding be setup on your wireless router, which may be a little tricky.  (I discovered that the iPhone app works seamlessly from outside the local network.  Accessing the camera from a web browser outside the network did not work as well.  There was often a considerable lag time between pressing the button to move the camera, and the move occurring on the screen.)So, if I was willing to use the camera connected to the router with an ethernet cable, the device would probably rate four or five stars.  However, I would like to put the camera in a location that cannot be reached by an ethernet cable (but still well within the range of WiFi), and I can't use it in that manner.I'm going to send it back, but I haven't decided what to do next.  Should I try another Tenvis, on the theory that I got a lemon?  Or should I try a more expensive option?  (Unfortunately, even the more expensive cameras do not get clean reviews on Amazon.)-----------------Update 1/24/2014I sent the first camera back and ordered a new one.  Same problem.  Operating under the theory that it is not a manufacturing defect, but something about my network, I decided to make an extra effort and try every possible setting on both the router and the camera.  I started with my Verizon FIOS router, made by Actiontec.  I tried all of the security settings and made sure no filtering was set.  No luck - same results as last time, the camera couldn't connect.  Then I tried connecting to my Apple Time Capsule wireless router.  After a bunch of attempts, I was successful.  The Time Capsule is set up with WPA2 security.  My passcode is 13 ascii characters long, and my recollection is that 13 ascii characters is the required length.  On the camera, the WAP2 section allows for a freeform passcode of any length.  I clicked on AES, and entered the 13 character passcode, and was able to connect.  I unplugged the camera and moved it to a location about 30 feet from the router.  It reconnected automatically after it was powered up again.  So far, so good.Now back to the Verizon router.  The security for the Verizon router was set to WEP, using the default 10 digit hex password.  Even though this corresponded to one of the settings on the camera, I was unable to connect using it.  So I bit the bullet, and change the security scheme on the router to WPA2, and entered a new passcode.  (All of my family will now have to enter a new passcode for all connections to this router, so this change has the potential for messing some things up.)  After making this change, I went back to the camera and changed the security scheme for the Verizon profile to WPA2, AES and entered the new passcode.  Viola!  It connected.  I guess the conclusion is that the camera should be used with a router that uses WPA2 encryption.  (Which is better than WEP anyway, so other than the inconvenience factor, that was a good change to make.)As a result, I've changed my rating to 5 stars.  Everything else about the camera is very good for the price.  I was easily able to set up the Tenvis app on my iPhone to view the camera remotely using the Tenvis DDNS service.  The motion sensor worked, and sends an email to my Gmail account when motion is detected.  The motion sensor can be turned on/off remotely from the iPhone app.  The infrared night vision works fine.  The audio probably isn't so great.  I can hear sounds that the camera detects, but they aren't very clear.  And I can speak into my phone's microphone and have my voice come through the camera.  I'm not sure that the audio aspect would make the product satisfactory as a baby monitor, but it is adequate for my home-monitoring objectives.The WiFi connection process probably shouldn't be this difficult - every other device that I've connected works without manually changing settings on the device.  However, now that it is working, I've got to give the product credit for what it does well.Update 3/14/2014Since my original review was negative, I will make a final update.As noted in the last update, I finally got the camera connected to WiFi.  Since then I have unplugged it a couple of times, and it reconnected immediately when restarted.  Other than being briefly unplugged to move the camera, it has remained on for almost two months.  The camera has remained on and connected the entire time.  It has always been accessible remotely with the iPhone app.  The app successfully controls the camera, and can be used to turn off and on the email alert system, which works well.  I'm confirming my five-star rating, which applies in spite of my initial problems in getting it connected to wi-fi.

Reviews.Title: For the Price, you can't beat it!
Reviews.Author: Robby
Reviews.Content: I didn't know what to expect from this camera partly b/c I'm new to surveillance cameras and partly b/c of the price.  After getting it set up and downloading the phone app, I can say that I love this camera.  It works great and fills all my needs.  Others from my family have seen it and are going to buy one too.

Reviews.Title: Does what I needed it to do.
Reviews.Author: R. Scott Brittingham
Reviews.Content: Got this to allow me to keep an eye on my elderly mother-in-law. Worked great! One note: in order to view in internet explorer 11, I had to enable compatibility view. I can watch on my computer, my android tablet, my windows phone, and from the internet when away from home.

Reviews.Title: Not recommended
Reviews.Author: michael hassler
Reviews.Content: Very complicated  and  I still cannot see the camera when I'm not home I would not recommend this to anyone

Reviews.Title: Great for the cost and works with any different programs
Reviews.Author: Rick A. Isaacs "R Isaacs"
Reviews.Content: For the price this is great cam, it s software is easy to use and best of all it works. The only down side I have experienced is at night time if recording through glass there is a glare from the leds. All around good, and I d buy one again...and probably will.

Reviews.Title: Very good Buy so far with excellent low light ability's.
Reviews.Author: T. Loposser
Reviews.Content: I am almost a week in testing this camera, three days inside after setting it up testing its ability and testing out software to use with it and then outside in a covered area for the past four days without a hitch. If you have a large network that includes more than one wireless router or network switches like my home network does be aware the software assigns it a fixed IP address which is good for working with the camera but can cause havoc once you try to go wireless for it if you did not setup the camera on the same IP address range. For example if your behind a second router that assigns the camera a IP address of 192.168.0.XXX and your main router which you intend to use it wireless with uses the range of 192.168.1.XXX the camera will never connect wireless. So make sure to plug it directly into the router with the wireless you intend to use comes from to get around this issue.The video quality is good for the price and only blurs when being panned around at a setting a Normal speed or faster so for a smooth video when panning use a slower speed. The light adjusting ability of this camera is outstanding, I can sit here and look outside a window and can barely see but the view from the camera makes it appear mid day and that's not even it using the night vision which works wonderful when you make sure to also account for the IR led maximum range. The Pan ability is almost funny that even though it is not stated as 360 deg, the camera can pan around far enough that it can see its own antenna from both directions so you can not hide from it in a circle but one tip I would give is that even though it states its 90 degrees Tilt it can really only go about 5 degrees down and 85 degrees up so if you intend to mount it over 5 feet in the air then mount it upside down like I did and invert the view in the software to correct for that and it will give you the ability to look all the way down including directly under the camera.

Reviews.Title: Neat.
Reviews.Author: G. Scott
Reviews.Content: i got this for some of my favorite people who were worried about their stuff being accessed while they were on vacation.  Using this nifty device, they got notified when their stuff was accessed, it auto took pictures, all all that cool jazz.  Neat, but i told them they should move out if they cant trust their roommates.

Reviews.Title: Very nice IP camera
Reviews.Author: Jack Gott
Reviews.Content: I chose this for the price.It meets all my expectations.  I might prefer zoom but the wide angle lens for security purposes is fine.I use this one for a driveway cam and I use it with zone alarm.  Great security system.Thanks.Jack

Reviews.Title: Feature Packed for Price
Reviews.Author: bwilli2
Reviews.Content: So far so good. I rolled the dice on this camera as for less than $50 it was hard to resist.It includes a ton of features at this price point which surprised me. Pan and Tilt, audio, various alerting methods.Wired setup is simple, wireless would have been, but there's no easy way to find the wireless MAC address.(Helpful hint, mine was one larger than the wired one.)Once I got it talking wirelessly on the LAN, configured my router to port forward to it and it's been working great.I can get to it from any of my phones remotely (using "IP Cam Viewer" on android), or via any browser.I wish it supported SSL though.We'll see how it holds up. It's installed in cat shelter outdoors, so with the cold coming on it may not last.-----Updated 1-18-2014So far so good. It's been trucking along with very cold temperatures (single digit) this winter. It's inside the shelter, so I'm not sure exactly how cold the camera has been, but it's still working.Some other notes: The two way audio on mine is not great. The mic on the camera works, but it's almost drowned out by a throbbing buzz noise. Not critical for me, but there ya go. Occasionally the color washes out, but the picture's still clear. The night vision has been very good in my application.All in all it's been a fantastic bargain.

Reviews.Title: Port Forwarding is a nightmare. Why isn't this compatible with all routers?
Reviews.Author: Dclogang
Reviews.Content: This product only has a few settings for a select few routers. It's a nightmare to set up. I still haven't done it yet. It has automatic settings for only a select few routers to be able to remotely view the video.Why it doesn't have all routers is beyond me. Had I known this I would not have purchased it.I do not recommend this camera for that reason.I'll change my rating if/when the company adds all the routers making it easier for users to

Reviews.Title: Great Product! Will save me money on video monitoring fees.
Reviews.Author: Q Harris
Reviews.Content: I did not want to add the expensive monthly monitoring and device fees which come with adding video security to my household alarm system account.  Then, I found this Tenvis camera on Amazon, which had the features I needed for a great price.  I connected the camera to my Wifi router and mounted it in a window facing my front door.  After about an hour of mounting and software configuration, i am now able to view my front door from any where in the world (laptop, tablet, and android phone) with no monthly fees!  The software allows for seamless addition of multiple cameras.  So, i definitely plan to get more of these cameras to cover addition areas of the house!

Reviews.Title: Great Product!
Reviews.Author: Alan Ingerson
Reviews.Content: The product was exactly as described and worked great. The camera is well built but small enough to be unobtrusive in the house. The operation of the camera is smooth and reliable with a clear image.

Reviews.Title: Nothing but a Struggle
Reviews.Author: Riley
Reviews.Content: At the price point, I thought I'd take a chance and try it knowing full well that I may run into problems other reviewers had. Unfortunately, there was no pay out and I ended up returning it.I wanted to like this little camera, but Tenvis made it very hard.First, as another review mentioned the power cord is rather short. Minus a half star for being restricted in placement of the camera.Second, finding the camera wasn't instant when I installed the IP Camera Wizard. In fact, I couldn't even find it at all. I hit the internet and found a forum referencing the Tenvis Search Tool for MJPEG. I don't understand why this tool isn't prepackaged with the disc, enough people have problems with the disc software that they needed to create a second tool. Anyway, this tool found the camera. Then, I have to install an ActiveX plugin to run the software in IE twice for it to work. Minus a star and a half for software not working without hassle.Third, I wasn't expecting a spectacular picture at 640, but I was expecting a good picture and I didn't see that. One of the biggest problems was it catching a large glare from the ceiling fan light. I messed with the settings, but I either reduced the glare and got washed out color or left the glare. I came down one morning to find it pointed at the ceiling. I also tried to setup local video saving, but never got it to work. Minus a star for all of that. Lo and behold, what did work fine - the night vision.Maybe I wanted it to be easier than I should have at this price. I'd rather pay a bit more for a better product and not have to waste time trying to get a cheaper product to work. Returning this. I don't think I'll be a TENVIS user anytime soon.

Reviews.Title: Easy and can use phone as well as computer and TV.
Reviews.Author: S. Forney "MiniDriver"
Reviews.Content: The device plugs in and with a bit of set up and software installation it appeared on my computer and android phone and I will be looking to getting it on my TV next.  Great picture and can be aimed up and nearly 360 degrees from my computer or phone.  This is ideal for security, pet monitoring and numerous other uses.  So simple, to install and use to think I was going to invest in a multi-camera security system and now all I actually need is the cameras.  Saving big bucks.

Reviews.Title: Love these things
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I brought these camera and they work great. I use the app on my Iphone to watch my home when not at home and it works great.

Reviews.Title: amazing value comes at a price
Reviews.Author: ciano
Reviews.Content: I ordered a NetGear refurbished wifi router and this camera for just a bit more than I would have paid for the new router at a big box store. Both items look to be in new condition. The router was a breeze to setup (see my review), but I can't say the same for the camera. I feel the deficiency is in the written instructions. I won't delve into my expletive peppered attempted setup session which lasted hours on end yesterday. I phoned the company and a delightful Chinese lady, whose English was obviously light years more advanced then my Mandarin, calmed me. Trust me, I was prepared to be very snarky about the blank cd which was included in the package, but she was so sweet and soothing, I knew I couldn't vent like I was so wanting to do. She also informed me that the password I kept trying to enter was actually blank. Not "blank", but ______, as in do not enter anything. She also directed me to to this [...] download section of the company's website. Starting again this morning, I decided to use the latest of about four different installation wizards for this camera which seems to have a somewhat indeterminate model number--maybe like Boeing 727 a,b,c,etc. I decided to start from the top and use the latest model and proceed down the list until something worked. Before downloading the wizard, I decided to follow the Tenvis setup tutorial[...]  I didn't hold out much prospect for the newest version of the wizard being the correct one because I thought this camera was refurbished and would be older, but Lo!, I followed the video step by step, pausing and replaying as necessary. About an hour and twenty minutes later, I was viewing my target room with my iPod Touch (free app CamViewer)via my NetGear router and the newly connected wireless IP Tenvis camera! What a great feeling of satisfaction and comfort this is. The picture quality is about 20x better than my old webcam, too. Recapping, the setup of this wireless camera is more difficult than the setup of the NetGear router, but someone with anything beyond beginner computer skills; patience; and the proper tools (password, wizard, instructional video, paper & pen for notes) can probably slog through the setup in less than two hours. Whew.

Reviews.Title: Better than others I've had
Reviews.Author: S. Fieldstone "Technology Manager"
Reviews.Content: I've had some bad experiences with wireless IP cameras and this one was refreshing that it worked out of the box.  I had no issues setting it up, but I am fairly technical...I knew how to change the sub-net to work on my network and what not.  I've used it both wirelessly and wired, though I currently have it on my house with a wired network connection.  I love that I can rotate it and move it from the web interface, even from my phone.  I use software iSpy to monitor and record with it full time and it integrates well.Only downside is I wish it had a wider angle lens.  This is more an issue with my use of it than the product itself, and I believe wide angle lenses can be found here on Amazon that will work.  I use mine for home security rather than room monitoring.All in all, the price is right and I would buy again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: blacksheepsigns
Reviews.Content: Always a little skeptical by reading reviews because some are terrible and come are good. I took a chance on this camera and so far am very glad I did! Easy to set up the camera, and set up devices to be able to view the camera (two cell phones and a kindle). The mounting bracket was an added plus, it flexes in a couple of spots, so I was able to use an existing screw on the crib and position the camera to see into the crib and still pan the full room. I considering another camera for our daycare provider as she loves the pictures it takes and ablity to easily pan and zoom from our phones.

Reviews.Title: Limited Utlility, Router Specific, LIght Correcttion Sensor malfunction
Reviews.Author: B. Birdwell "birdwe11"
Reviews.Content: Installation:  Installation software requires a direct (wired) ethernet connection to your router.  My router does not have a default ethernet port so installation was problematic.Features:  Audio, two-way audio, remote viewing, recording, motion detection, alerts, and perhaps other features, depend on which router and browser you are using.  Download the manuals first to see if your devices are supported if you are not a "loves-a-challenge" techo programmer.Functionality:  This camera worked great when I had it set up inside.  I moved it outside in a covered, sheltered location, where it worked fine for an evening and night.  I was very happy with the night vision.  The camera's video capture capabilities failed at/after sunrise.  After rebooting the camera I managed to get an image, however, it displayed various false colors.  The video failed whenever I tried to make a change (panning, changing capture settings). I think the sensors that compensate for range of light somehow failed. Inside, in darker conditions, the camera worked fine.  After dusk, outside again, the camera was able to capture video but the image was  high contrast and so details were much poorer than the previous night.  The next day, the ability to capture video failed altogether.  At this point I packed it up.

Reviews.Title: This IP carmera is more than I expected
Reviews.Author: Jia Yan
Reviews.Content: I was looking for the IP Camera good quality and lower price for a while, this one matchesmy requirement. the functions are same as other expensive IP camera, but price is lowerthen others a lot. it's easy to setup. just plug in its AC adapter and plug it into your router.Follow the instructions... done.the functions and picture quality is very good. I'm impressed!I can check my home from anywhere anytime.Email alert is very useful function when there is any motion detected.High recommend this ip camera.

Reviews.Title: Good value for money
Reviews.Author: Sfrancis
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera  a week ago , I have to say this was an  easy installation than I thought .Picture quality is good . it served my purpose and it is really a  good value for money .

Reviews.Title: Great product and good price
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Cheng
Reviews.Content: The webcam works great and was simple to setup. The pan and tilting functionality of the webcam is very flexible and allows to get great angles of any room. There is also a 2 way audio setup on the camera that allows you to hear and talk through it. The price for this camera is just astonishing, for $60 you're getting a high quality security camera. It also has some safety features like sending an email when it detects something in the area, but you can always turn that off if you want.

Reviews.Title: Great product at a bargain price
Reviews.Author: Tao Zheng
Reviews.Content: Bought a TENVIS JPT3815W for its good price. TENVIS made it tremendously easy to setup, I choose the "Wizard Mode" during setup, I am not exactly tech savvy but I was able to detect the cameraon my network instantly. I followed the setup instruction and successfully connect to WiFi wirelessly!  This company offers access URL for users to view the camera image through internet, which is fabulus. The setup wizard has automatic way to set port forwarding, unfortunately that doesn't work for me.  However, by following the instructions on zettaguard.com website (their distributor), I was able to setup the port forwarding.Images is great, Pan/Tilt control is very smooth.  IR cut is not included,  but I have no complains due to its price. The product can remember 6 preset positions for quick navigation, it works perfect. It has 2 way audit so I can hear what is happening in our living room through the camera.  You can take picture snapshot, save videos on your hard drives -I explored most of features and I am so happy to own this camera.  The only thing need to improve is its browser compatibility - it works with IE the best, but not so good with other browsers.

Reviews.Title: Great product and features for the price
Reviews.Author: Jonathan L Yu
Reviews.Content: I got the Camera today and it literally took me 8 minutes to get the Camera setup. The pictured instructions are pretty straight forward to get the camera configured. Just follow it step by step. It's easy and effortless. The picture quality/resolution is pretty good for the price. It's pretty cool to see what my Kid's doing in the other room with my Ipad/Iphone. I am planning to get me a few more of these cameras for the house.

Reviews.Title: Great! Little tricky to set up.
Reviews.Author: ikle4ever
Reviews.Content: Great camera.  does the job very well but not very flexible.Have not figured out how to get the Audio to work, I think it needs speakers (which is not great as I assumed it will have a built in tiny speaker)Difficult to set up but follow instructions (including those on a review on Amazon) and you will get there.All in all, I like it!

Reviews.Title: Amazing lil gaget, could use better software
Reviews.Author: Maxx
Reviews.Content: real easy to setup, the web/GUI is basic, no recording options, only snapshot. Tried using 3rd party apps, but the settings never worked.Quality is really good, and the IR is good too.Small gripe like everyone else is the green led is bright and cannot be turned off, thinking about putting ele tape over it.  but this is a great cheap alternative compared to a 400$-600$ kit.  movement is smooth as long as the WIFI signal is strong enough.

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Service...
Reviews.Author: PcM "certified geek"
Reviews.Content: I've had this little IP camera since last October, about 7 months, and it's been pulling harsh duty out in the chicken coop. Keeps an eye on the flock... the other day the power adapter gave up the ghost.Contacted Tenvis about it and they've got a new adapter on the way to me... easy as that. So along with a great little camera you've got a company that will help you out if things go wrong... can't beat that!

Reviews.Title: Great Product, Great Price
Reviews.Author: Sean Edmonds
Reviews.Content: Received this product and had it up and running in 10 mins. I actually bought this because my daughter was hearing noises in the attic. When I received this I put it up in the attic to see if I could identify the source of the noises. While I still haven't seen any little critters, the camera is terrific. It's pitch dark up there but you couldn't tell by looking at the camera. The infrared lights make it seem light daylight (although you lose the color aspect). The pan and tilt work great. This camera has no zoom ability. I am able to access the camera via PC, IPAD, and smartphone and control the camera.

Reviews.Title: Camera is good, customer service not so much
Reviews.Author: R. Reed "Prof. Reed"
Reviews.Content: So I bought this camera in order to watch my cat while I was at work who had been misbehaving. Let me say the positives first, once I got this set up, it worked very well and I prefer its web software (which has user definable presets) better than the software which comes with foscan, swann, and wan (I have a swann, but have looked at the manual for the others). This is impressive given that this camera is the least expensive if the foscam clones out the. The night vision worked well, the ddns was easy to set up (with port forwarding) and it was cool to watch my cat from my office. If you use your cell phone however, bear in mind this will take a lot of data. My spouse burned through half her data allotment (about a gigs worth) in a week.But on the other hand, my story is not great. I had problems from the start with this camera. The install did not complete, it errored out and inhad to set the camera up manually which involved a lot of network stuff. The software that came with it was never able to see the camera over wifi (though I was still able to connect to it over its built in web server). I tried emailing us customer service, I tried calling them every other day for a week. Unlike the other person who reviewed this, I never got a call back. I was never able to access it from my ipad using an application (only the browser). I believe something was wrong with the camera. Eventually it stopped working completely (after about two weeks) and now just continually reboots. I contacted their international support through their forums and got a response asking me to email them. I have, and am waiting for a response. So I got a broken one, and their customer service has been lousy. On the other hand they have a support forum and the people on that were very helpful. But if something is really broken, not just set up wrong, don't expect quick help.In the meantime, I purchased a swann camera from radio shack. It works great, but its software is not as good as the. Tenvis, so I will probably order another tenvis camera and take the swann back. The swann uses the same software as the foscam.In summary, I recommend the tenvis, if it installs easily you are good to go, if it doesn't then don't expect much support. This is why I gave it 3 stars.  If I hear for customer service, I will update this review.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: chuckster
Reviews.Content: I have fooled around with several different cameras and they all had issues.This camera only stumped for a little while.You have to have a wireless router because the ip changes on the road runner router and the century link router.I have road runner and I would get the camera to work and then it would'nt work.It turns out that road runner does not have a static ip witch is required to transmit video.The installer worked great.For the price it was very well worth it. Here is a link to my camera here at home.Check it out. [...]  Click on the access word.  user is admin  password is 62856.

Reviews.Title: Tenvis IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have used this camera for four months, it works well the video is ok not great, I do wish it had zoom and a few more options for alarm setup since this is my main reason for having an IP Camera. It does work well for the money I got mine from Ebay.The setup process can be a problem I had to work through several issues. The manual is not much help there. it is not well written.
